intro: Plectranthus bishopianus, commonly known as the purple-leaf plectranthus, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple foliage and small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with partial to full sun exposure. Its leaves are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory properties. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
